entry.title: coat of arms of Curaçao (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a design competition was held in 2022 to find a replacement for the coat of arms of Curaçao (depicted)?

entry.title: Carter Moore Braxton (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Carter Moore Braxton fought for the Confederacy throughout the American Civil War and, according to one report, had seven horses killed under him but avoided any wounds?

entry.title: Adoration of the Magi with Saint Helena (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Adoration of the Magi with Saint Helena was once the main altarpiece at Sant'Elena, a church dedicated to its namesake?

entry.title: a ballot measure that took away their power on that issue (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after the Supreme Court of Ohio imposed restrictions on bail procedures, the dissenting justices participated in a bus tour to campaign for a ballot measure that took away their power on that issue?

entry.title: a peace monument (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a peace monument was erected for Turkish journalist Abdi İpekçi in the place where he was shot and killed by an assassin 21 years earlier?

entry.title: Sky Trek Tower (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 2016 an inflatable gorilla was erected on the top of the Sky Trek Tower for Six Flags Great America's Halloween event Fright Fest?

entry.title: Bernard Rwehururu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ugandan military officer Bernard Rwehururu originally wanted to become a Catholic priest, but enlisted as a soldier to pay for his siblings' school fees?

entry.title: Delsworth Buckingham (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Delsworth Buckingham was an Odd Fellow?
